intro: Tricholemma breviaristatum, commonly known as the short-bracted tricholemma, is a rare and specialized plant species characterized by its unique botanical features. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family, and is typically found in moist, nutrient-rich soils in temperate regions. The plant exhibits a distinctive morphology with narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. Its reproductive structures are adapted for wind pollination, which is common among sedges. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in many regions.
